Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ....back orders and you never called them.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can you believe this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There's a dog in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You can't leave a dog in a parked car. [points to "I'd rather be snowboarding" bumper sticker] Snowboarder, it figures.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do Snowboarders hate animals?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I bet this guy didn't leave his weed in the car. OK we have to do something because this is incredibly dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oscar, it's not that hot out.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: A car parked in the sun is like a toaster oven.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, we don't know how long the driver's been gone and it's not in direct sunlight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So what, Andy, you wanna just let him die, you scumbag?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Here, I'm gonna get in my car. When I start dying, I will honk the horn three times. That means save the dog.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, you know what? I'm gonna give him something to drink. Come here, doggy. [Whistling and pouring water from bottle into sunroof of car] Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight! At least aim it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There you go! Here doggy! He's not even trying. Come here doggy, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're losing cloud cover.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh don't try to get in on it now, Michael Vick.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. Vick did his time.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This guy's been gone long enough. He's lost his right to a window. [Oscar approaches the vehicle with a tire iron]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come on buddy, get back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa, Oscar! What are you- What? No, hey! [Oscar busts out back window, group cries out in protest, then cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright! Nice job, Oscar!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And one for good measure! [Busts out taillight, group applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So...ah, who's gonna take the dog?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why would we take the dog?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What if he jumps out the window and runs away?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jim, he's not gonna star- [Dog lunges for open window and barks]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Shh! Shh! Stay there, stay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nein. Sits. [snaps as dog calms] Goot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oscar, what do you wanna do, this is kinda your deal. You wanna dog?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Oscar pokes holes in cardboard now taped over window] There we go. That should do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, that'll work.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That'll work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bye poochie!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Bye. [Andy barks]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Bye! [Kevin's horn honks twice shortly, then one long honk. Shot shows him passed out on his steering wheel.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's that come to? Like, what did they each win?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man, it's gotta be over a hundred thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Before taxes.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's still a lot of money!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The warehouse crew won the lottery yesterday. Nine hundred and fifty thousand dollars. And then they quit!...and no one else can focus. [shot shows warehouse crew going wild in the office] This is it. This is all on my shoulders. I'm the one who has to tell everyone to get back to work, I'm the one who has to tell Darryl to hire a new warehouse crew. I'm the one who has to say those things.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [On phone] Hello?....Justine! [laughs] Nice surprise! How you doin' baby?....Nah. No no, I didn't win. When I got promoted I stop-...what?...Yeah. Yeah, Glenn won....Oh, you wanna call him? Yeah, you should call him, congratulate him. That'll be-...What?....Oh, his number's in your old phone. Oh, you know what? I might have it right- [hangs up] Whoops.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: When I worked in the warehouse, I was part of that lotto pool. They won ... playing my birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What really interests me is the group dynamic of six people winning the lottery. This will not end well. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: We're lookin' at at least one suicide and one weird sex thing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: At least.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, I don't even know what I'd do with all that money.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know what you'd do with all that money. [imitating Jim] "Hey Pam, let's buy expensive bathrobes and hug."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'd probably buy a big piece of land in Maine, build a house, work in town. Somewhere I could bike to or kayak to. I'd either bike to my job at the kayak shop or kayak to my job at the bike shop.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And then on the weekends, would you hacky sack back to reality and spend time with your wife and kids?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa. Saucy. I thought you liked Maine?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think we should get a townhouse in SoHo...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: SoHo's mostly lofts but OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And then every morning, I'd walk out on to my terrace and I would breathe in the inspiration of the city. You know? And just gather ideas for my painting...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, god.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And then my handsome husband...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which ideally would be me....

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Would bring me a flavored coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop. I'm a barista in your fantasy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well in your fantasy we're Stephen King characters.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know about Stephen King, I mean...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [under her breath] get a divorce...get a divorce...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think I would keep working. And for my salary I guess I would take like a dollar a year....I mean obviously I wouldn't come in till noon and I wouldn't do anything I didn't wanna do. I mean I'm getting paid a dollar a year, OK? You can chill.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?! Guys if I have to ask you to get back to work one more time, I'm gonna change my tone. [lowers voice] To down here like Mr. T. and this will get seriously annoying. I feel sympathy for the jerks who have to listen to this all day. [normal voice] Darryl, how we doin' on the new warehouse guys?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What d-? What..what? Wuh, do we have new guys, or what?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are they on their way over?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I haven't hired anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What? No warehouse guys? I have an important order that has to go out by five. I emailed you about it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm not checkin' email till lunch. Four hour work week.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is kinda time sensitive.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I got it. I'm doin' it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, this is a seriously big order. I can't lose this client.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, well until we have a new crew, let's get some volunteers for warehouse duty. Who's in? [Erin raises hand]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: As long as you guys don't need me up here.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No..we don't

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think we'll be fine. [group murmurs in agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really, nobody's gonna help her? Is chivalry dead?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you volunteering?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Of course. I would. But my hip....I would kill to be at a hundred percent. [Angela rolls eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim! How 'bout you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. I mean, as the strongest person in this office, I guess I should go down with you...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey...OK no. No. That. You are so not...oh god. [grunts] False. Andy, I will volunteer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great. And Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good old Kevin. He'll do anything. Well guess what? I will not do a good job.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. What's this? [holds up clipboard]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry. I thought it was a guess your baby's birth weight pool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It says "Lotto Pool", right on top. [points to obvious title]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah. And I said sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh come on. You really think I'm gonna have a fourteen pound baby?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: When did I get so fat?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You look awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I didn't hire anyone if that's why you're here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where are we in the process?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I have a file of applicants here. I just gotta open it, look at it, interview a bunch of guys,hire some of 'em. So I'd say we're in the early stages of the process.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you go out celebrating with the guys last night?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The guys did invite me out to celebrate but I decided to just stay home. Eat a bunch of tacos in my basement.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You do have a fantastic basement.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I did. I did have a fantastic basement. Now it smells like tacos. You can't air out a basement and taco air is heavy. Settles at the lowest point.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right. Um, well how 'bout we take a look at some applications? ...This guy wrote his in green ink, that's pretty cool. Check it out. [attempts to give Darryl application who ignores him at first but then takes it]Hey! There ya go...there he is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is not Darryl. I don't know where Darryl is. I suspect probably our Darryl is inside of fat Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. Three hundred boxes of twenty pound white. That's seventy-five boxes per person, so that's not so bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Negative! Three hundred boxes for me, zero for you chumps. Deal with it! [climbs into forklift]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. [Dwight runs forklift into wall of warehouse] Whoa whoa whoa whoa! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Damn! [Dwight reverses pulling the wall with him. Erin screams. Dwight leaves forklift and begins lifting boxes by hand.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Welcome, everybody! My name is Andy and this is my other brother Darryl.[no one laughs] What? No Newhart fans? OK...Darryl, how do we usually kick these things off?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You mean what did we do the last time the warehouse won the lottery?

Quote.Speaker: Female Applicant
Quote.Text: Your old crew won the lottery?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does anyone have experience? Shelving, storing, keeping track. What do we use, the Dewey Decimal system?

Quote.Speaker: Male Applicant 1
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. So all the old guys quit?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: One of 'em, Glenn, is starting one of those fat camps where he steals your kid in the middle of the night. Madge and a couple other guys might start a strip club, but on a boat. And Heday is investing in an energy drink for Asian homosexuals. [Andy laughs awkwardly]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, can you guys give us a minute? But stay close, you're all doing great. [group begins leaving] maybe grab a coffee..or if there's any donuts out you can split one. You know they're for everybody so people get fussy....You know what? Just have a donut. [shuts door and sits, gesturing for Darryl to sit next to him. Then gets up to stand near Darryl.] Do you wanna talk about this not winning the lottery thing?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You sure? Cause you keep talking about it, so...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nope. I'm good. I'm here. Let's find some warehouse workers.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good. Great. Then can you say things that aren't like a huge bummer to everybody? Cause the more I talk, the more they're gonna realize I don't know what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We need you, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Grunts while lifting box into truck] What's the problem? Grunting is scientifically proven to add more power. Ask any female tennis player. Or her husband. [Erin grunts loudly and tosses box toward truck but misses]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I didn't feel anything.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright! Thank you for coming back in, again. Uh, now we're gonna ask you a few questions. Darryl, you have the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why do you wanna work here?

Quote.Speaker: Male Applicant 1
Quote.Text: I need a job.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's not a good reason.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good. Keepin' 'em honest.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Don't just take the first job that comes your way. Cause next thing you know, it's ten years later and you're still there. Could write your obituary tomorrow, it's not gonna change.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are we scaring them straight....?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I hope so. Think about this carefully. There's better lives than this one.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I've never been lucky. And I'm not talkin' about the lottery, I'm talkin' 'bout stuff like developing a soy allergy at thirty-five. Who gets a soy allergy at thirty-five? And why is soy in everything?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nice. Right back where I like you. [Pam is sitting at reception covering for Erin] Can you make ten copies of this for me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why not? What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, buying lottery tickets online. [Ryan laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah, everyone wants to be rich, but nobody wants to work for it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You came in at 10:30 today, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK, (we'll just dismiss it.)??????

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is everyone licensed?

Quote.Speaker: Male Applicant 2
Quote.Text: Like a driver's license?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Warehouse license....Masters in warehouse sciences?...I, I feel like Darryl has talked about a license of some kind.

Quote.Speaker: Female Applicant
Quote.Text: Is this a joke?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Not joking. This is real....painfully real, what is happening right now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [On all fours with a box on his back] OK, I'm not gonna make it. I'm turning back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's gotta be a better way to do this. This is literally how they built the pyramids.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, they whipped people which was helpful. But you're right. We should be able to find a more efficient way of moving boxes than Madge or Heday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah [laughs and then notices camera] Not that they're not smart people.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Noticing camera] No, no. Very smart. Uh, theirs is more of a physical intelligence.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'd go with that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like baboons or elephants.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not that, don't...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys! When I was a kid, my sisters used to butter me up and slide me across the linoleum floor of the kitchen. Then really made them laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a great idea Kev, I don't think it applies here though, so maybe we just-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah we move stuff and it was fun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin! Doesn't apply.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right. My mom-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [grabbing Kevin's arm] You need to drop it, OK? They hate it. I like it a lot but they hate it so drop it! [Kevin tears up]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does anyone get distracted easily by bubble wrap? [raises hand and laughs] You'll be dealing with lots of bubble wrap obviously. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Male Applicant 1
Quote.Text: How much longer is this gonna take?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Did you hire 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Because they all left.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What do you mean "they left"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, after you bailed? I got confused and frankly a little weird and the stuff that you said certainly didn't help.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Then I think you should fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you talking about? I'm not gonna fire you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. Just put me out of my misery.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: .....OK, this is weird. I don't, I don't get the joke.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No? OK. I don't wanna be here anymore. Fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So Darryl says to me "fire me". But what he really means is "I'm gonna say something really weird, try and figure out what it means." So I say "No, you're not fired." But what I really mean is "I have no idea what your talking about, but I'm gonna go ahead and hire some people for the warehouse and hope that you eventually start feeling better."........I really hope that's what he and I mean.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Attention! Does anyone know anyone who could work in the warehouse? We can pay. Come on Oscar, who's the most jacked guy in all of Scranton? Like your wildest fantasy guy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Bulk or definition?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Definition.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Bruce Kenwood. He hangs out at Plant Fitness.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are those just show muscles? Or is he really strong?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, he's plenty strong.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It used to be Reggie Winters out at Gold's Gym. But he moved away. And then it was between Bruce and this guy Dean. Um, but Dean got fixated on his calves and uh, and his triceps went to hell.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So. I've been thinking, after we win the lottery, we take our winnings....

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Our fake winnings

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we move to the south of France. See? No, there's plenty of bicycling for you. I think that's where they do the Tour de France.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is, yeah. I mean I just don't know why I'm compromising if it's my fantasy. Cause in my fantasy it's Maine and you love it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because I'm never gonna act like that, even in your fantasy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. You're, you're doing a great job of it in my fantasy right now. [Pam sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, idiot. What did Erin want again?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A...hot chocolate tea

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gideon. You are a PhD candidate studying America's diminishing blue-collar workforce?

Quote.Speaker: Gideon
Quote.Text: North America...and, diminishing is a little reductive, but uh sure. That's the headline version.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great....Well, it'll bring a fresh new perspective to the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Gideon
Quote.Text: FYI, Wednesday through Friday I have a pretty full teaching schedule.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Eh, cool. We'll figure that out.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Also, FYI, ah, I don't techinically have a hearing problem, but sometimes when there's a lot of noises occurring uh at the same time, I'll hear 'em as one big jumble. Uh, again it's not that I can't hear, uh because that's false. I can. Um, I just can't distinguish between everything I'm hearing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Got it. Dually noted. You! [points to Bruce] Coolest tank top I have ever seen. Where did you get that?

Quote.Speaker: Bruce
Quote.Text: Made it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So cool! What a cross-section we have here. That's what I love about interviewing. I get to meet all these people I wouldn't ordinarily meet or know or even talk to.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Message in a Bottle, The Postman...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kevin Costner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin Costner.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Shot shows Kevin and Erin greasing floor of warehouse]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So I found this grease. And then I remembered that you thought it was a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You did say it was a great idea. I heard you say it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, it's not the dumbest idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not the greatest one either...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But, the fact remains we gotta move these boxes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And it's clear we're not going to carry them. [Dwight grunts loudly in shot showing them sliding boxes over the greased floor]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So sadly, it's the best idea on the table.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think we're ready to give thi- [Kevin slips on grease and falls] Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is he OK?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yep. He'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Surprise! Your new crew.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Would you just fire me, man?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why? Because you didn't win the lottery? How am I supposed to make you happy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You wanna make me happy? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Give me your job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Haha, what?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll do it better than you. I earned it. I deserve it. I got passed over, God knows why, reasons I cannot and will not understand. The job was mine Andy, everyone said it was mine. Make me manager or fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna give you my job! It's my job! I earned it! And here's the thing, you weren't even next in line. I asked about you, I saw your file. You have a history of being short with people and you hired Glenn, your buddy! To replace you in the warehouse. He was under qualified. They saw that.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Also, Darryl, FYI, I already told this to Andy, but uh, you should probably know I technically don't have a hearing problem, it's just when there's a lot of noises...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nate! Please....thank you. You have no business education, you were gonna take classes under D'Angelo, what happened to that?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He died.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He didn't die, his brain died. And my brain is still very much alive and I'd be happy to give you business classes. How come you haven't asked me about it?

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: What wa-, what was the last...I'm havin' a-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: None, no part of this has anything to do with you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I didn't have time because of my daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, but you had time for a softball clinic, and a Mediterranean cooking class.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey I'm not gonna tell you this stuff if you gonna throw it back in my face.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. Here's the thing. Jo saw something in you. She loved you! She gave you a shot and then you stopped pushing. She noticed. [long pause]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK what?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK, don't fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My future's not gonna be determined by seven little white lotto balls. It's gonna be determined by two big black balls. I control my destiny. I do.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I put some guys on tonight. Best of your bunch and my bunch. Tell you now though, it's gonna be mostly my bunch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. [laughs] That makes sense. OK. Good, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Here...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is goin' on?! [shot shows greased aisle flanked by rows of boxes]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why is the forklift in the wall?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why is the truck empty?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, it's not totally empty.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Is that grease on my floor?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, I can see why you're angry, you're coming into this cold. But believe me a lot of thought went into this.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And did your brains tell you to ruin these boxes with grease?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: OK Darryl, listen and then you will understand. The boxes were ruined during our first trial testing so now it's cool cause we found another use for them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, alright, that's...look. All we were trying to do is we thought we could come up with a more efficient way to do things.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And we did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jim? Tell them what it's called.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No Jim, tell 'em what a name is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Doesn't matter what the name is. Señor Loadenstein, that's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [laughing] Señor Loadenstein. Tell 'em why it's called that, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's OK, we're good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jim...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, Jim. Tell us why it's called Señor Loadenstein.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Porque es muy rapido.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. You know what? It's been a real busy day, what do you say we put all this away.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let me see it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's uh, it's in beta testing.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let me see it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get the thing, go! Lube it up, Kevin! Start mopping.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight, Erin, Jim & Kevin
Quote.Text: Uno! Dos! Tres! [Shot shows Jim & Dwight pulling ropes attached to a plank holding Erin in a helmet and boxes of paper down the greased runway, Dwight grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I lost my client.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I already won the lottery. I was born in the US of A, baby. And as backup I have a Swiss passport.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I would spend a lot of time launching my true crime podcast, The Flenderson Files. Dum bum buh. [whispers] Flenderson files.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We came to an agreement. We're going to live in a stunning pre-war brownstone at the top of a mountain.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right. It's city and country combined.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just a subway stop away are the best museums in the world.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I can fish right from the window of Pam's pottery studio. And we can chat any time we want.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just like now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] Just like now....too bad the schools are terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But what are you gonna do about that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: If I won the lottery, I don't know. I don't think I'd make any changes to my life. Quit my job, move, meet someone....

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd give 35% to AIDS related charities. 25%. If they can't cure AIDS with 25%, the extra ten's not gonna make a difference. At some point, you're just throwing good money after bad.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The first thing I'd buy is new boobs. For my mom. She has the worst boobs. It- It's embarrassing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, ok. We are so close. All we have to do is figure out that corner and we're basically there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. Kevin, we've been friends for a long time, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Egons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So if I was to ask you to sacrifice your body and lay down on a greasy corner and act as a human bumper shield-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight! Come on. Here, I think I have an idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wouldn't be asking you lightly, now would I?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Now do you wanna wear a trash bag, er...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dammit Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: However it's normally done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I have a question. Why is the truck so far away?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah Jim, why's it so far?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Why's it so far away?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I just asked that ques-, I don't know. I mean it seems like the door is huge, right? So you should be able to back the truck up to the paper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, why is it so far away Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So this warehouse has been around for what? Like a thousand years? And they never thought to back the truck up into it? I guess sometimes it just takes a fresh set of eyes. Alright! [knocks on side of truck]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Back...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That looks good. Back. Whoa whoa whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa whoa whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're doing great! A little farther away from the wall!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No no no!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Good...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No! Stop! Stop stop stop stop! You're way over! Ok, you gotta cut it! Cut it hard! (bleep!) Stop stop stop stop! Stop, stop! Dammit Dwight. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.
